Remote-access Distributed Fiile System

Jan. 2020 - Apr. 2020

- Developed a distributed file system in C++, which supports clients to create, open, read, write and close files on the remote server by designing new Remote Procedure Call (RPC) protocol integrated with FUSE operations.

- Achieved strong consistency by introducing mutual lock mechanism and freshness check, which enables only one single client to modify a file and multiple clients to read files concurrently. Reduced server workload through upload/download mode with client-side caching.

- Proved the system logic correctness by tracking the log files, deploying units tests in Python and end-to-end tests in Linux.
